Package Helper

Class Helper

java.lang.Object
Helper.Helper
public class Helper extends Object
A utility class that provides helper methods and utilities for common operations such as input validation, date-time processing, and user interaction. The class includes methods for reading and validating user input, generating unique IDs, validating date and time formats, and managing console-based UI operations.
Since:
2024-11-17

  • Method Details

    • readInt

      public static int readInt()
      Function to read an integer value from terminal

      Repeatedly tries to read an integer until an integer is actually being read. Keeps catching the exception InputMismatch when invalid characters are entered

      Returns:
      The read integer entered in the terminal.

    • readInt

      public static int readInt(int min, int max)
      Function to read an integer value from terminal that within the specified minimum and maximum arguments.

      Repeatedly tries to read an integer until an integer within the specified range is actually being read.

      Keeps catching the exception InputMismatchException when invalid characters are entered.

      Keeps catching the exception OutOfRange when an integer entered is lesser than the minimum or greater than the maximum value specified as arguments.

      Parameters:
      min - minimum valid value that will be read and returned.
      max - maximum valid value that will be read and returned.
      Returns:
      The read integer entered in the terminal.

    • readDouble

      public static double readDouble()
      Function to read a double value from terminal.

      Repeatedly tries to read a double until a double is actually being read. Keeps catching the exception InputMismatchException when invalid characters are entered

      Returns:
      returns the read double entered in the terminal.

    • readFloat

      public static double readFloat()
      Function to read a float value from terminal.

      Repeatedly tries to read a float until a float is actually being read. Keeps catching the exception InputMismatchException when invalid characters are entered

      Returns:
      returns the read float entered in the terminal.

    • readString

      public static String readString()
      Reads a new line of string
      Returns:
      user input as string

    • promptConfirmation

      public static boolean promptConfirmation(String message)
      Method to prompt confirmation from the user. Usually for confirmation of removing data
      Parameters:
      message - Message for confirmation prompt.
      Returns:
      true if user input 'yes'. Otherwise, false.

    • generateUniqueId

      public static <K, V> int generateUniqueId(HashMap<K,V> database)
      Method to generate unique id for hashMap key
      Type Parameters:
      K - Generic type for the key of the HashMap
      V - Generic type for the value of the HashMap
      Parameters:
      database - Hashmap object to reference
      Returns:
      A unique id for the database

    • isValidDate

      public static boolean isValidDate(String dateString)
      Function to validate a date string in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
      Parameters:
      dateString - the date string
      Returns:
      true if the date is valid, false otherwise

    • isValidTime

      public static boolean isValidTime(String timeString)
      Function to validate time input in the format "HH:mm".
      Parameters:
      timeString - the time string
      Returns:
      true if the time is valid, false otherwise

    • validateDateTime

      public static List<String> validateDateTime(LocalDateTime dateTime, Helper.TimeValidationRule... rules)
      Validates a date-time value against a set of specified validation rules.
      Parameters:
      dateTime - The LocalDateTime to validate.
      rules - The validation rules to apply.
      Returns:
      A list of validation error messages.

    • promptAndValidateTimeRange

      public static LocalDateTime[] promptAndValidateTimeRange(String startPrompt, String endPrompt, Helper.TimeValidationRule... validationRules)
      Prompts the user to enter and validate a time range. Continues prompting until a valid range is provided.
      Parameters:
      startPrompt - The message to display when asking for the start time.
      endPrompt - The message to display when asking for the end time.
      validationRules - Rules to apply when validating the time range.
      Returns:
      An array of two LocalDateTime objects representing the start and end times.

    • isValidTimeRange

      public static boolean isValidTimeRange(LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end, Helper.TimeValidationRule... rules)
      Validates if a given time range is valid based on the provided rules.
      Parameters:
      start - The start time of the range.
      end - The end time of the range.
      rules - The validation rules to apply.
      Returns:
      true if the time range is valid, otherwise false.

    • validateAppointmentTime

      public static LocalDateTime[] validateAppointmentTime(String scheduleDate, String startPrompt, String endPrompt)
      Method to validate start and end times for an appointment. Keeps prompting the user until valid times are entered (end time must be after start time).
      Parameters:
      scheduleDate - The date of the schedule (e.g., "2024-11-05").
      startPrompt - The prompt message for start time input.
      endPrompt - The prompt message for end time input.
      Returns:
      An array of LocalDateTime, where [0] is the start time and [1] is the end time.

    • validateTimeInput

      public static LocalDateTime validateTimeInput(String scheduleDate, String prompt)
      Method to validate a time input in HH:mm format. Repeatedly asks the user to enter the time until it is valid.
      Parameters:
      scheduleDate - The date of the schedule to combine with the time input.
      prompt - The prompt message to ask for the time.
      Returns:
      The validated LocalDateTime object, or null if the input is invalid.

    • pressAnyKeyToContinue

      public static void pressAnyKeyToContinue()
      Method to pause the application and prompt user to press the ENTER key to continue using the app.

    • clearScreen

      public static void clearScreen()
      Clears the terminal screen for a neat interface experience.

      Uses the system's command to clear the screen.
